objtitle.title: Letter from Willey Reveley, c. 18 October 1791

objdescid.compdate: 1791Willey Reveley's letter to Blake is dated "Oct 18" in Reveley's hand, but the partial postmark stamp, "C OCT / 7", suggests it may have actually been posted by [1]7 October 1791. Bentley (Writings volume 2, page 1521) notes "The date of the letter is in some doubt [...] for though Reveley clearly dated the letter 'Oct 18', the numeral in the postmark is equally clearly a '7'. I cannot reconcile these facts." Blake's undated reply to Reveley was written on the back of the letter he received by post from Reveley. According to Essick (Huntington, page 185), "Blake refers to his willingness to engrave for Reveley 'by the end of January' some illustrations for James Stuart and Nicholas Revett, The Antiquities of Athens. Volume 3 (1794) of that work (see Part III, section B, No. 48) includes 4 plates by Blake dated 3 April 1792 in the imprints. Thus, Blake must have written his note, a direct reply to Reveley's letter, shortly after 18 October 1791." See also the note on Number of Leaves, below.

objinfo.objsize: Full sheet 15.0-18.9 x 23.2 cm.Unfolded full sheet and Leaf Size dimensions (height x width) are given according to the vertical orientation of the body of Reveley's letter to Blake; see the note on Number of Leaves, below. objinfo.numberleaves: 2The full sheet bearing Reveley's letter (Object 2) was folded into two leaves, which were folded further to form a packet for posting. Blake's address (Object 1) appears on what would have been the exterior of the folded packet. The leaf bearing object 1 is torn and partially missing. Blake's undated response to Reveley, not pictured, is written on the reverse side of the leaf bearing Blake's address (Object 1); see the note on Composition Date, above. Unfolded full sheet images can be accessed under Supplemental Views on the Object View Page. Blake's letter to Reveley, dated c. 18 October 1791, is also available as a separate work through the Index of Letters.

provenance.price: £84This price includes all items in lot 214 in the 1918 Linnell sale; see the note on provenance below.
provenance.note: John Linnell; sold from Linnell's estate, Christie's, 15 March 1918, probably in lot 214 with 12 (?) other letters by Blake (£84 to the dealer George D. Smith acting for Henry E. Huntington) including 10 (?) letters by Blake to John Linnell of 10 November 1825, 19 May 1826, 5 July 1826, 16 July 1826, 29 July 1826, 1 August 1826, 27 January 1827, 2 undated letters (one probably of March 1825, inscribed "12 O Clock/Wednesday" with an 1818 watermark, and the other probably of February 1827), and probably 3 July 1827; and 2 letters by Blake to Mrs. Linnell, one of 11 October 1825 and one undated (inscribed "Sunday Morning", probably of 5 February 1826). Although Blake's letter to Reveley appears to be an unsent draft, no fair copy has been located.

objnote.p: Blake's undated letter (Object 1), probably a draft, is written on the right half of the reverse side of a letter that he received from Willey Reveley; see the note on Composition Date in the Work Information. The full sheet bearing Reveley's letter was folded into two leaves, which were folded further to form a packet for posting. The second leaf, not pictured, bearing Blake's address in Reveley's hand and the remnant of the postmark stamp, is torn and partially missing. Unfolded full sheet images can be accessed under Supplemental Views on the Object View Page. Reveley's letter to Blake, dated c. 18 October 1791, is also available as a separate work through the Index of Letters.
